meanings.definition: Combine (two or more texts, ideas, etc.) into one.
meanings.sent1: She conflates her favorite books into one exciting story.
meanings.sent2: The chef conflates flavors to create a unique dish.
meanings.sent3: The teacher accidentally conflates the math and history lessons, making for a confusing class.
meanings.sent4: His speech conflates humor and seriousness, keeping the audience engaged.
meanings.sent5: The artist skillfully conflates colors to bring life to the painting.
